docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity
docs.text: "Affinity is an optional affinity selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity
docs.text: "Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:

docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution

withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAntiAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: obj spec.infraTolerations
docs.text: "InfraTolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraTolerations is specified, the webhook and certmanager will be able to be scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withEffect
docs.text:
withEffect(effect)

"Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withKey
docs.text:
withKey(key)

"Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withOperator
docs.text:
withOperator(operator)

"Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withTolerationSeconds
docs.text:
withTolerationSeconds(tolerationSeconds)

"TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withValue
docs.text:
withValue(value)

"Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizers
docs.text:
withFinalizers(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizersMixin
docs.text:
withFinalizersMixin(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withGenerateName
docs.text:
withGenerateName(generateName)

"GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server. If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header). Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency"

docs.text:
withLabels(labels)

"Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels"

docs.title: fn metadata.withLabelsMixin
docs.text:
withLabelsMixin(labels)

"Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels"

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources, although some resources may allow a client to request the generation of an appropriate name automatically. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names"

docs.title: fn metadata.withNamespace
docs.text:
withNamespace(namespace)

"Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique. An empty namespace is equivalent to the \"default\" namespace, but \"default\" is the canonical representation. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.\n\nMust be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces"

docs.title: fn metadata.withOwnerReferences
docs.text:
withOwnerReferences(ownerReferences)

"List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller."

docs.title: fn metadata.withOwnerReferencesMixin
docs.text:
withOwnerReferencesMixin(ownerReferences)

"List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withResourceVersion
docs.text:
withResourceVersion(resourceVersion)

"An opaque value that represents the internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. May be used for optimistic concurrency, change detection, and the watch operation on a resource or set of resources. Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency"

docs.title: fn metadata.withSelfLink
docs.text:
withSelfLink(selfLink)

"SelfLink is a URL representing this object. Populated by the system. Read-only.\n\nDEPRECATED Kubernetes will stop propagating this field in 1.20 release and the field is planned to be removed in 1.21 release."

docs.title: fn metadata.withUid
docs.text:
withUid(uid)

"UID is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is typically generated by the server on successful creation of a resource and is not allowed to change on PUT operations.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids"

docs.title: obj spec
docs.text: "NMStateSpec defines the desired state of NMState"

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraNodeSelector
docs.text:
withInfraNodeSelector(infraNodeSelector)

"InfraNodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraNodeSelector is specified, the webhook and certmanager will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraNodeSelectorMixin
docs.text:
withInfraNodeSelectorMixin(infraNodeSelector)

"InfraNodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraNodeSelector is specified, the webhook and certmanager will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraTolerations
docs.text:
withInfraTolerations(infraTolerations)

"InfraTolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraTolerations is specified, the webhook and certmanager will be able to be scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraTolerationsMixin
docs.text:
withInfraTolerationsMixin(infraTolerations)

"InfraTolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraTolerations is specified, the webhook and certmanager will be able to be scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.withNodeSelector
docs.text:
withNodeSelector(nodeSelector)

"NodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to handler DaemonSet manifest for both workers and control-plane (https://github.com/nmstate/kubernetes-nmstate/blob/main/deploy/handler/operator.yaml). If NodeSelector is specified, the handler will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

docs.title: fn spec.withNodeSelectorMixin
docs.text:
withNodeSelectorMixin(nodeSelector)

"NodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to handler DaemonSet manifest for both workers and control-plane (https://github.com/nmstate/kubernetes-nmstate/blob/main/deploy/handler/operator.yaml). If NodeSelector is specified, the handler will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.withTolerations
docs.text:
withTolerations(tolerations)

"Tolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to handler DaemonSet manifest If Tolerations is specified, the handler daemonset will be also scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.withTolerationsMixin
docs.text:
withTolerationsMixin(tolerations)

"Tolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to handler DaemonSet manifest If Tolerations is specified, the handler daemonset will be also scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.infraTolerations
docs.text: "InfraTolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraTolerations is specified, the webhook and certmanager will be able to be scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withEffect
docs.text:
withEffect(effect)

"Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withKey
docs.text:
withKey(key)

"Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withOperator
docs.text:
withOperator(operator)

"Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withTolerationSeconds
docs.text:
withTolerationSeconds(tolerationSeconds)

"TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withValue
docs.text:
withValue(value)

"Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string."

docs.title: obj spec.tolerations
docs.text: "Tolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to handler DaemonSet manifest If Tolerations is specified, the handler daemonset will be also scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.tolerations.withEffect

withEffect(effect)

"Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute."

docs.title: fn spec.tolerations.withKey
docs.text:

"Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys."

docs.title: fn spec.tolerations.withOperator

withOperator(operator)

"Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category."

docs.title: fn spec.tolerations.withTolerationSeconds
docs.text:
withTolerationSeconds(tolerationSeconds)

"TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system."

"Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizers
docs.text:
withFinalizers(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizersMixin
docs.text:
withFinalizersMixin(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

docs.title: fn metadata.withGenerateName
docs.text:
withGenerateName(generateName)

"GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server. If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header). Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency"

Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.\n\nMust be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces"

Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency"

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withTopologyKey
docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.labelSelector.withMatchLabels
docs.text:
withMatchLabels(matchLabels)

"matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is \"key\", the operator is \"In\", and the values array contains only \"value\". The requirements are ANDed."

"operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.namespaceSelector
docs.text: "A label query over the set of namespaces that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces selected by this field and the ones listed in the namespaces field. null selector and null or empty namespaces list means \"this pod's namespace\". An empty selector ({}) matches all namespaces."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withNamespaces
docs.text:
withNamespaces(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withNamespacesMixin
docs.text:
withNamespacesMixin(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withTopologyKey
docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

"If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity
docs.text: "Affinity is an optional affinity selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity
docs.text: "Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.text:
withNamespaces(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withNamespacesMixin
docs.text:

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withTopologyKey
docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withNamespaces
docs.text:
withNamespaces(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAffinity.requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withTopologyKey
docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.podAntiAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

docs.title: obj spec.infraTolerations
docs.text: "InfraTolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraTolerations is specified, the webhook and certmanager will be able to be scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withEffect
docs.text:
withEffect(effect)

"Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withKey
docs.text:
withKey(key)

"Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withOperator
docs.text:
withOperator(operator)

"Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withTolerationSeconds
docs.text:
withTolerationSeconds(tolerationSeconds)

"TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system."

docs.title: fn spec.infraTolerations.withValue
docs.text:
withValue(value)

"Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizers
docs.text:
withFinalizers(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizersMixin
docs.text:
withFinalizersMixin(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withGenerateName
docs.text:
withGenerateName(generateName)

"GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server. If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header). Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency"

docs.title: fn metadata.withNamespace

"Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique. An empty namespace is equivalent to the \"default\" namespace, but \"default\" is the canonical representation. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.\n\nMust be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces"

Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency"

docs.title: obj metadata
docs.text: "ObjectMeta is metadata that all persisted resources must have, which includes all objects users must create."

docs.title: fn metadata.withAnnotations
docs.text:
withAnnotations(annotations)

"Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations"

docs.title: fn metadata.withAnnotationsMixin
docs.text:
withAnnotationsMixin(annotations)

"Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations"

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withClusterName
docs.text:
withClusterName(clusterName)

"The name of the cluster which the object belongs to. This is used to distinguish resources with same name and namespace in different clusters. This field is not set anywhere right now and apiserver is going to ignore it if set in create or update request."

docs.title: fn metadata.withCreationTimestamp
docs.text:
withCreationTimestamp(creationTimestamp)

"Time is a wrapper around time.Time which supports correct marshaling to YAML and JSON. Wrappers are provided for many of the factory methods that the time package offers."

docs.title: fn metadata.withDeletionGracePeriodSeconds
docs.text:
withDeletionGracePeriodSeconds(deletionGracePeriodSeconds)

"Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set. May only be shortened. Read-only."

docs.title: fn metadata.withDeletionTimestamp
docs.text:
withDeletionTimestamp(deletionTimestamp)

"Time is a wrapper around time.Time which supports correct marshaling to YAML and JSON. Wrappers are provided for many of the factory methods that the time package offers."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizers
docs.text:
withFinalizers(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

docs.title: fn metadata.withFinalizersMixin
docs.text:
withFinalizersMixin(finalizers)

"Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withGenerateName
docs.text:
withGenerateName(generateName)

"GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server. If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header). Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency"

docs.title: fn metadata.withGeneration
docs.text:
withGeneration(generation)

"A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state. Populated by the system. Read-only."

docs.title: fn metadata.withLabels
docs.text:
withLabels(labels)

"Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels"

docs.title: fn metadata.withLabelsMixin
docs.text:
withLabelsMixin(labels)

"Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels"

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withName
docs.text:
withName(name)

"Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources, although some resources may allow a client to request the generation of an appropriate name automatically. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names"

docs.title: fn metadata.withNamespace
docs.text:
withNamespace(namespace)

"Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique. An empty namespace is equivalent to the \"default\" namespace, but \"default\" is the canonical representation. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.\n\nMust be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces"

docs.title: fn metadata.withOwnerReferences
docs.text:
withOwnerReferences(ownerReferences)

"List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller."

docs.title: fn metadata.withOwnerReferencesMixin
docs.text:
withOwnerReferencesMixin(ownerReferences)

"List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn metadata.withResourceVersion
docs.text:
withResourceVersion(resourceVersion)

"An opaque value that represents the internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. May be used for optimistic concurrency, change detection, and the watch operation on a resource or set of resources. Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency"

docs.title: fn metadata.withSelfLink
docs.text:
withSelfLink(selfLink)

"SelfLink is a URL representing this object. Populated by the system. Read-only.\n\nDEPRECATED Kubernetes will stop propagating this field in 1.20 release and the field is planned to be removed in 1.21 release."

docs.title: fn metadata.withUid
docs.text:
withUid(uid)

"UID is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is typically generated by the server on successful creation of a resource and is not allowed to change on PUT operations.\n\nPopulated by the system. Read-only. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids"

docs.text: "NMStateSpec defines the desired state of NMState"

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraNodeSelector
docs.text:
withInfraNodeSelector(infraNodeSelector)

"InfraNodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraNodeSelector is specified, the webhook and certmanager will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraNodeSelectorMixin
docs.text:
withInfraNodeSelectorMixin(infraNodeSelector)

"InfraNodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests If InfraNodeSelector is specified, the webhook and certmanager will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraTolerations
docs.text:
withInfraTolerations(infraTolerations)

docs.title: fn spec.withInfraTolerationsMixin

docs.title: fn spec.withNodeSelector
docs.text:
withNodeSelector(nodeSelector)

"NodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to handler DaemonSet manifest for both workers and control-plane (https://github.com/nmstate/kubernetes-nmstate/blob/main/deploy/handler/operator.yaml). If NodeSelector is specified, the handler will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

docs.title: fn spec.withNodeSelectorMixin

withNodeSelectorMixin(nodeSelector)

"NodeSelector is an optional selector that will be added to handler DaemonSet manifest for both workers and control-plane (https://github.com/nmstate/kubernetes-nmstate/blob/main/deploy/handler/operator.yaml). If NodeSelector is specified, the handler will run only on nodes that have each of the indicated key-value pairs as labels applied to the node."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.withTolerations
docs.text:
withTolerations(tolerations)

"Tolerations is an optional list of tolerations to be added to handler DaemonSet manifest If Tolerations is specified, the handler daemonset will be also scheduled on nodes with corresponding taints"

docs.title: fn spec.withTolerationsMixin
docs.text:
withTolerationsMixin(tolerations)

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.nodeAffinity
docs.text: "Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.withWeight
docs.text:
withWeight(weight)

"weight associated with matching the corresponding podAffinityTerm, in the range 1-100."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm
docs.text: "Required. A pod affinity term, associated with the corresponding weight."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withNamespaces
docs.text:
withNamespaces(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withNamespacesMixin
docs.text:
withNamespacesMixin(namespaces)

"namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means \"this pod's namespace\"."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.podAffinityTerm.withTopologyKey
docs.text:
withTopologyKey(topologyKey)

"This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed."

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity
docs.text: "Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s))."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

docs.title: fn spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin
docs.text:
withRequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied."

Note: This function appends passed data to existing values

docs.title: obj spec.affinity.podAntiAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text: "The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity
docs.text: "Affinity is an optional affinity selector that will be added to webhook & certmanager Deployment manifests."

docs.title: obj spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity
docs.text: "Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod."

docs.title: fn spec.infraAffinity.nodeAffinity.withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
docs.text:
withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)

"The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding \"weight\" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred."

withPreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecutionMixin(preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution)
